scenarioDescription:
The GJ 876 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 876 is a star with 0.32 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.3 times its radius. It is located 15.25 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

GJ 876 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 876 system


GJ 876 b

GJ 876 b was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 1998-10, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.21 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 876 b is 723.641 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 876 b is 13.300 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, GJ 876 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


GJ 876 c

GJ 876 c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory, in 2001-07, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 876 c is 227.116 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 876 c is 14.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, GJ 876 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


GJ 876 d

GJ 876 d was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2005-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 876 d is 6.678 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 876 d is 2.510 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 876 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.


GJ 876 e

GJ 876 e was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory, in 2010-08, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.33 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 876 e is 14.628 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 876 e is 3.920 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 876 e is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 876, which contains 4 exoplanets and was discovered by the Multiple Observatories.
name: GJ 876 - System With 4 Exolanets
